oXB8AaCZAP-1lcO5KyNVJw.text: Our first butcher shop in the Valley, but after reading reviews this was THE place to go.  Got some soup bones for the pups, two steaks for us for dinner shouldn't have gone the sirloin steak as said 'was very good' next time will stop trying to be cheap and go with the good stuff.  Also got a ham slice that is the BEST we've ever had, can't wait to go back and stock the freezer with some more delish.  Maybe go back during the week when it's not quite so busy and standing room only.

Ah_2GEpVxSii_FdgoNfAOw.text: I absolutely love this place!  I don't buy meat at the grocery store anymore because you simply can't after experiencing the incredible quality, the staff that is helpful and friendly and the fun atmosphere.  The butcher is an artist, really, you don't see people waiting and looking at their phones, they're watching a master at work, thank you!  The variety of products is endless, minus today's visit, my husband and I try and buy a new item each time. I can't emphasize this enough, you must go and buy your meat for your next BBQ, Monday night dinner or whatever.  We are forever changed! Thank you!

fYV0Y1EsQZCO5qhoHq6njA.text: I have never written  a review before but I read about John Mulls yesterday and just happened to be around the corner from there today so I stopped in. To say this is a hidden gem is an understatement. The meat is fresh and cut to order, but its the people that work there that make the place. They are knowledgeable and friendly, plus the prices are great! I will definitely be back!

naTk4mVeqY0BszAj96IogA.text: I have always lived in the Henderson and the southwest side of Vegas . now that our family had bought a house in the northwest area I'm always trying to venture out and fine new places for us to dine at. This place I have to say was an amazing find, a little hidden and at first was a little apprehensive because of that but now that I look back on the dining experience there it just adds to the curiosity of the whole event.we had the pulled pork sandwiches, hot links,with green beans, mac and cheese,and an extra side of the macaroni salad . Everything was to die for amazing. I highly recommend the restaurant along with checking out on buying some meat to grill at home their prices are fantastic.

MDbQemPlMNBBJQIKOVfKVA.text: I've been to a couple of local BBQ joints in town and have hated them all. I finally admitted that the only place I could get decent BBQ is Lucille's or Memphis BBQ. I was talking to a coworker about the lack of good BBQ in this city and she mentioned the Road Kill Grill. She said that she lived close by and since I lived on the opposite side of town, she would stop and get me a plate. The next day she came in with a very heavy styrofoam plate and told me that the price had recently gone up to $15. When I got home, there was chicken, ribs, links, and brisket along with mac & cheese, and beans. There was a regular sauce and a spicy one. The amazing part of it all is that ALL of it was very good.  I was shocked. It was VERY good, only cost $15 and the two of us ate off of it for three days. What an amazing meal. I have only one regret. I live so far away from it. I'll definitely have it again.

YQL430FiX2OeqErxZQkEKA.text: Best BBQ I've ever had at the best price! Long wait but totally worth it! Great service from start to finish. Definitely a must when in Vegas!

ALzKVhZcubq7t9vv6Ge8Yg.text: I was really looking forward to this place. The beans and Mac n Cheese were great. The meats were dry and tasteless.  The service was very friendly and the prices were fair

k-IU2Wtbd3N2gIrbPqvW5g.text: Have been coming here for years. The food is always amazing and the people are friendly. Love mulls!!!!

E2nPlS2WLhwI4G8HqiTBsg.text: A hidden gem in the world of meat. The woman behind the counter was very friendly and helpful. The meat is excellent, and you get a free flat of 30 eggs with a minimum purchase.

jzr6Qb8YlKCYnbS6v8Jm9Q.text: Vastly over rated. They only get the third star because of portion size. Dry pulled pork slathered in a sweet sauce to mask the dryness. Dry brisket slathered in beef broth to hide the dryness. Possibly the most fattening mac and cheese on the planet. I think they use mayo. Potato salad was ok. Cornbread was way too sweet. This is unthought out bbq. Mistakes absorbed as knowledge. The old kind done by non-hipsters. The result is an inferior product redolent in every assertive element with no balance or subtly or excellence. This "home cook" level of bbq just doesn't cut it anymore. If they had options in LV maybe they wouldn't even have been on TV. And they are so slow filling orders. Hard to get to. Notice that everybody that loves this place has a common look (no frame of reference) and live in places that aren't known for bbq.. I live in the south. Ignore the Jersey thing. I was in Jersey when I signed up and they put that in. Didn't feel like changing it.

XFGuBEp6yGZvTX-Kf051ZA.text: I dropped off a deer on Dec 8.  The gentlemen told me it would be ready in just a few days.  I called back the following weekend and the woman who answered said it still wasn't ready.  Today, Dec 22 (2 weeks later) I called at 9 AM.  The woman this time told me she was too busy to even check and see if my deer was ready, and that I should call back at 3 PM.  How unprofessional?  I live nearly an hour away so dropping by isn't really an option for me.  I will not return to this business.

w1garwXAIIkf_1ToxwlHGw.text: I ordered the brisket but was graciously given a single rib to try for future reference. Wow, definitely worth the rib they gave me, because I will DEFINITELY go back and order the ribs. Super tender, beautifully seasoned, and not doused in BBQ sauce for flavor. I am not even sure I would put their delicious sauce on my next order of ribs because the ribs were so great by themselves. Oh and back to the brisket, it's easy to forget anything when thinking about those ribs. Brisket sandwich was HUGE, and delicious. My buddy ordered Pulled Pork and that was great too. Service is top notch and I will gladly drive back to North Town for more!!

QPQzCs_YlyD7D-FQZfQ6rQ.text: One of the best hidden restaurants in Vegas that was featured on The Food Network (wall is signed by Guy Fieri from Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives).  This place was highly recommended by locals when we moved to the area and we finally got a chance to check it out today. We found the spot last night, but it was closed and what a surprise!!  We thought the GPS was not working correctly since it had us in the midst a rural residential area complete with horses across the street and this appeared to be some type of ranch.  We decided to try it out for lunch and once again we were struck by the rural surroundings complete with a gravel driveway.  There is nothing fancy about this place, but it still attracts crowds (like a down-home bbq).  The lot was crowded and the "Grub Shack" (outside eating area with water misters..woohoo) was full! We ordered at the small inside counter / butcher shop area that was packed with customers as well as employees bustling around taking  & filling orders and our wait was still only about 15 minutes...the pulled pork (sauce had nice spicy kick to it) was the best I've had since coming to this area and the beef brisket was tender & juicy "cooked to perfection"; the mac & cheese had too much of something so I wouldn't order that again, but the portions and the inexpensive prices make this a spot that we recommend & will bring out of town guests to visit as well.

q8OVHqaHqLonCHOT_x-whA.text: Some of the BEST BBQ I've had since living in Oakland, CA!! Soo much food! Love the Mac n Cheese--it's the real deal! You won't be sorry if you take a little drive to this little gem!

SEXPA0VIbWM6VpivaLSRJQ.text: I thought my GPS was sending me on a wild goose chase. Ended up in a subdivision in the middle of nowhere, but found heaven. The ribs were fabulous, and the brisket was almost as good as mine (of course I'm biased). The employees were great...Nice, courteous young men.

a2P7Im74fPLPY2eqiuKwdA.text: Absolutely love this butcher shop. From the moment I walked it, it was a fun and family/co-worker atmosphere. Everyone working was happy, joking, and having a good time, all while still doing their jobs efficiently. Outstanding employee's and very customer friendly!!!!  Quite a few customers inside, which was a good sign this place is a favorite to many people. I bought my order with a Groupon and added an additional $30.00 to my order. Enough meat for about 3 weeks. Everything was packaged perfectly, right in front of me. I love seeing my meat coming from being cut.   It's not hard to find and you get a great choice for a variety of meats. Give it a try if you can. Prices are excellent and it's worth the few minutes waiting for them to pack the meat for you.

2EYf7FoUHfcVChCzy4BzdQ.text: OMG! one if the BEST BBQ joints I have been to! A little off the beat & path but the GPS did not let us down, nor did the food. A no frills place....granted service was a little slow but well worth the wait! The Mac and cheese was out of this world! Definitely a do over when in town again!!

okTZfexxPzzfB5duvq2N3g.text: Ol Rawhide dip shit...is full of sht! So what ever the dumb fkr has to say is also full of sht! He can't get from la to vegas since triple d was over and make his dumb asz remark...no way any way!!! just some fkn green freak!

nigsd8BIyluwASpF6pZHyg.text: I'm a Texas girl and was having the craving for some BBQ, in all the years I've lived here (over 20) I have never had any BBQ in this city that can come close to the best BBQ which in my humble opinion is from Texas. So I jumped on yelp to see what was out there, maybe just maybe there's a hidden gem in the city of sin. So after reading some reviews we decided to check out the road kill grill. The name alone sounds interesting, and it was featured on the food network.....so I'm not gonna lie we got a little giddy. Driving up it was very cool, it's ranch style setting, you eat outside on picnic tables and they are smoking the meat out there. It gives you that vibe of family reunion or family gathering on a Sunday afternoon, I dug that. Now the first red flag was they are smokin the meat outside but there was no delicious aroma of meat smokin in the air. I wanna smell that meat smokin, it gets my mouth goin! So the husband orders what he always gets when we eat BBQ..... Brisket sandwich. I decide to try something different so I ordered a plate of chicken with green beans and Mac and cheese. So we'll start off with the brisket sandwich. The brisket didn't look like brisket. Brisket should be brown and crispy on the outside and pink towards the center. It should melt in your mouth and flake apart. The brisket looked nothing like that, it looked as though they had boiled it, not smoked it. When he opened the styrofoam container that held his sandwich I thought they messed up on his order and gave him pork, because the meat looked like pork not brisket. There were no pickles, no mustard, and no onions which are what make a brisket sandwich. The BBQ sauce they provided for dipping I will say was delicious. Now onto the chicken. That was delicious, very moist and very juicy. The flavoring was excellent, and I think should be considered their best item. The green beans were full of flavor and scarfed up immediately. The Mac and cheese was really good as well, it was baked and didn't have an overabundance of cheese. Overall if I could give this place 2 1/2 stars I would, I can't stretch to a 3 just based on the fact that the brisket was so off. I'm still on my quest to find some delicious Texas style BBQ here in the valley. I'm getting kinda tired of having to drive all the way to Phoenix to have Rudy's just so I can have some good BBQ.

7HwII2Obq3kCdnYj8txxrw.text: I go to Vegas at least twice a month and didn't know this place existed. I became used to the mediocre BBQ here and there and thought this would be the same. Consider my foot in my mouth. The location is at the end of a residential street on a mini ranch. When i pulled in, i knew it was going to be something special.   The overall wait was 15 minutes from line to table. I picked the brisket dinner with mac and cheese and candied yams. Huge portions for 14 bucks. You also have the choice of mild or hot bbq sauce on the side.  The brisket was so tender and juicy my mouth was in disbelief. The sauce was rich and thick which complimented the meat well. Mac and Cheese was creamy and delicious and those candied yams should come in a bucket on the side.   The best part? IT REHEATS WELL. The left overs were better than the first day. Meat still juicy the next day. My mother and I made a deal to drive to Vegas once a month just for the BBQ. Yes it's that good.

photos.caption: Photo of John Mull's Meats & Road Kill Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

8D7JN6Okg2kSYK7S_WiBYA.text: Amazingly delicious! Hot, yummy, huge portions! The people are friendly & welcoming. Worth the money every time. Never disappoints!

IDnr4CSlRAEwRdkbKCmNOA.text: Every time I come here there are many different faces I exhibit.  There is one of tiredness as it took me 45 minutes to drive here, one of longing as I wait forever to get my food, one of salivation as I finally see the food being served up, one of ecstasy as I'm eating it, and one of disappointment as I realize I didn't order enough and am not still eating.  This place is great.  The people are friendly, the place is in a neighborhood which at first was weird but as improvements have been made, has become very welcoming.  People may come here because it was featured on TV once or twice but people keep coming back because it is that good and has become a staple.  I don't care that I have to drive for nearly an hour to get here or wait for a half an hour or more to eat, I am just thankful that this place exists and that I get to enjoy it.  Everything I have tried here is great.  You cannot go wrong even if you just closed your eyes and picked at random.

photos.caption: Photo of John Mull's Meats & Road Kill Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Two meat combo with macaroni and cheese, potato salad, corn bread, hot links, and ribs.  I should&#39;ve gone with three meats!

vspy6W7AYzqvKQHDbLWIuQ.text: Great food, love their ribs and smoked sausage. Just make sure you go in the cooler months because the seating is outdoors

AiofDOideGnzKXrx_WltFg.text: I absolutely love this place.  Today, being 4th of July I decided to get some BBQ. They had a live band. Giving away hamburgers and fries for free while we waited. Free water and those of us who were still there waiting in line an hr after closing got free tshirts.  We were treated like Kings and Queens.   Thank you Road Kill Grille, you are top shelf!!

BS11H-bCsVFVbu9Tufcuww.text: The best smoked whole turkey in the world. Get one every year and the leftovers make for amazing soup and sandwiches. Also amazing meats, including hard to get things, and the amazing Road Kill Grill. Super friendly staff. Don't let the outward appearance of the place scare you off.

vao84i6mNQVrWPTzHbq3gw.text: Yes Yes YES!  GREAT BBQ!!!  I ordered the three meat combo that came with two sides and I was almost overwhelmed by the quantity, quality, and taste!  This is the real deal home-cooked stuff you crave!

photos.caption: Photo of John Mull's Meats & Road Kill Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Three Meat Combo w/ two sides

3O_mFFdrEOl93wJ_XO04bQ.text: I went to John Mull's with my team from work for lunch.  We got there around 11:30 and there was a line but it wasn't too bad. We waited for about 15mins until our turn to pick up our orders.  Things I loved: -The collard greens was the best thing I had that day. Flavor was great and it wasn't too salty. The texture was nice as well, it wasn't over cooked and mushy. -The brisket was flavorful and moist. I enjoyed it very much.  Things I liked: -The Mac cheese was pretty good; the flavor was nice but just a personal preference that I prefer smooth mac and cheese, the one they had was not smooth. That's the reason I liked it but not loved it. -The hot links tasted fine but just way too much sauce for my liking.  Thing that just okay: The pulled pork flavor wise was fine. Nice smoky flavor but I found the meat was bit too dry.  Overall I enjoyed the meal and will come back to try other meat. I saw a lot of people ordered rib tip and there's what I'll order next time.

photos.caption: Photo of John Mull's Meats & Road Kill Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 3 meat combo with collard greens and Mac and cheese

Wbxv7Y0CRZWYxLJyjSxHGA.text: I was expecting more.   It fits the clickish 'we don't care about you (just look at our facility and the associated customer amenities), we only care about our food' which is the snobby version of an intentional hole-in-the-wall BBQ joint. Problem is, their food didn't live up to what it takes to get away with that approach.   I ordered the three meat plate; brisket, pork ribs, hot links. Sides were mac & cheese, potato salad and bread choice was cornbread.   The brisket was extremely disappointing. Dry, tough, chewy, and obviously cooked well before being served. My guess is re-heated which is a cardinal sin.   The ribs were slightly better than average. Again, a little dry and reheated. Okay flavor but just plain lacked that savory, decadent quality I look for in a rib.   The best if the meats was the hot links which, ironically, should be the understudy of BBQ meats. Nice flavor, not too hot, good texture with a crisp casing.   Now to the sides; the mac & cheese was okay. The mac was a little too bready which made the overall dish a bit mushy. Wish I had a dash of salt but, I refer back to my customer amenities comment.   The potato salad was exceptional. Nice size potato pieces (not big chunks that over power the dish), properly cooked being the right mixture of firmness but still not too much so and creamy flavor glue that held it all together.   The cornbread was the best part of it all. Excellent flavor to moisture to texture balance. That said, even it fell short being cold with butter not a readily available option (again I refer to customer amenities).  Summary: I've been to a number of places like this. Most have been better than average to exceptional. I've also been to strip mall BBQ joints that have had both a better quality product and a comfortable place to enjoy my meal.

kJyTPrzkOv7izVbs3-ZSgg.text: Locals favorite I have a hat from the place I run into people that know the place and give it a shout out!  You need a gps to find it

rnkkd22dFsJwJNWzmK2nDQ.text: Best bbq in Vegas as far as I am concerned. You know it's good food when you don't have to worry about the ambiance. Small butcher on site smoked brisket and ribs. Great bbq sauce. It is a little pricey but all good bbq is. If your coming to have a sit down lunch take it to the park down the street. A few shaded benches out front but not known as a real sit down restaurant. Great food from the Mac n cheese to the hot links all good. Seen it on Diners drive inns and dives.

Q0pWrBa7M8vh-tXy30EW0Q.text: I get a text Saturday from my husband that says "John Mull's tonight"   I agreed mostly because I love BBQ, I didn't feel like cooking, we've lived in Vegas our entire lives and never tried it, and everyone I've known to eat there said it's so amazing (I'm going to question these people ;) )  Saturday at 3:15 the line was really long but we drove 40 minutes to get there and just decided to stick it out. It literally took over an hour to get our food, we got into the car at 4:30! And to be honest there is NO reason that it should have taken so long. Inefficient way of working and I can't believe the wait time for pre-cooked sub par food.  The food....I'm going to be 100% honest. It was gross. I got the brisket and hot links with potato salad and mac and cheese, husband got pulled pork, brisket, and hot links with yams and mac and cheese. My son got the pork ribs, pulled pork, cole slaw and mac and cheese. My mom got the 1/4 chicken and pulled pork.  The brisket was boiled (no bark), mostly fat (legit barely any meat) and had no flavor. The hot links were smothered in what I can only describe as being ketchup...the potato salad was in the same container as the hot food items so it was also hot. The yams were pretty much canned Princessa. The mac and cheese was really good but that's about it.  I will never go there again. Rollin' Smoke gets my money every time.  **this review is strictly on the food, not the employees. They were all extremely nice and it's not their fault the business runs badly and the food is awful**

BVfyKfRIKke4DKvj5mM-YA.text: Had a great time delicious food and we got there right around 1130 before any lines.  You can eat outside where the have shade tents and fans.  Friendly folks and the brisket and hot links are delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of John Mull's Meats & Road Kill Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Outdoor tent view
Photo of John Mull's Meats & Road Kill Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu
Photo of John Mull's Meats & Road Kill Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brisket and hot link combo plate

1EJwhW3IzkHgdSGMt5EJ0g.text: While driving here GPS was taking us through a residential area, I swear that thing was getting us lost! Turns out it wasn't lol.  Once inside we got in line to order food, since it was a weekday it wasn't too bad. Between my sister & I we we able to try their beef brisket, tri tip, pork ribs, hot links and beef rib. Beef rib was delicious, I had to wait a while cause it wasn't ready well worth the wait. The meat just fell off that bone. Other things I really liked were brisket and the links, I did use the extra BBQ sauce they gave us I would prefer the spicier one than the mild one. For the sides we tried which were baked beans, potato salad, macaroni salad, I liked the beans the best the others were ok. Oh and we both got to try their cornbread, man yes it's a little sweeter than the norm but delicious.  I would say the food experience for everything would definitely be between 4 to 4.5 stars for sure. The 5 stars go to the service and the friendliness of the staff, awesome people around here. We will definitely be back if and when we're in the area.

g3YaaGbunM9kA2u4PCk_gQ.text: Best BBQ Meal I've had for $22 bucks, handsdown...there's NO comparison.  Go here, you'll LOVE IT!!

A18yktbaIwOwOtKHtAZ9Mg.text: brisket is bland and watery, pork ribs very dry, hot links too sweet for my liking and why did I even ordered the cobbler but I love the mac and cheese and potato salad. Will I be coming back? No

photos.caption: Photo of John Mull's Meats & Road Kill Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

g1wdt-Ob13fTFAecjl44SQ.text: Catered a work party through them and they couldn't have been more helpful. You can go and have lunch which you can order off their regular menu and you can cater for a party by ordering half or full pans.   We tried to order a bit of everything Brisket Pulled chicken and pork BBQ Chicken Potato Salad Mac & Cheese Greens Youuuu name iiiiiiiiiiiit!  The brisket and pulled pork were the favorites amongst the meats we ordered and that Mac & Cheese wouldn't have been enough if we ordered 10 of them. Not because of small portions but because people devoured it.  They butcher and cook everything on site so it's a cool place to grab some lunch away from all the rest of the Vegas madness.  Staff is very welcoming and friendly and make sure we got everything we needed. I will definitely be back!

bTDKE5-ak-SdE1BeN9KjHg.text: Late review for 9/8/18.   When out of town, we liked to find local food to devour like there's no tomorrow. Las Vegas is no different. For many years I have enjoyed restaurants on the strips and things just gotten too boring. We picked this place after looking through yelp for a recommendation and we were not disappointed! We came mid day in 110F but that didn't stop us from enjoying our food with sweat streaming down our face and neck. I could say this was one of best homemade style bbq place I've eaten.   My favorite was hot links, beef ribs, mac n cheese and collard greens.   This place serves your food in a cafeteria style with outdoor communal seatings. So, if you're here during winter time, check the weather and dress accordingly.

photos.caption: Photo of John Mull's Meats & Road Kill Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of John Mull's Meats & Road Kill Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

HqBB04KqaHFN2xPTtzNt8w.text: BEST BBQ I'VE EVER HAD! HANDS DOWN, BEST BBQ IN LAS VEGAS! This place is literally a hidden gem, you go down some small street and it's on this huge lot. I'm Black, I've been having bbq my whole life. And never had bbq that tasted this good. AND THE MACCARONI!!!! Omg bombbbbbb! The yams ?! BOMBBBBBB THE BURNT ENDS?! BOMBB!!!! By far those were the best burnt ends I've ever tasted. The Beans?! BOMB THE SAUCE!!  SOOO GOOD ! Like everything was so delicious I am  amazed and I'm not exaggerating, the food is that good.   Thankyou Larry and Deondre Williams for all the help and great service. We really appreciated it. This place is so  homey, like the food tastes like it was made with love. Can't wait to bring all my family and friends here.

photos.caption: Photo of John Mull's Meats & Road Kill Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Everything in this picture was absolutely delicious
Photo of John Mull's Meats & Road Kill Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. BEST BBQ IVE EVER HAD

Yl0TDCX19fC86WOgbrv-Ow.text: If you want indoor seating drive a little further up Decatur to the Clark County Shooting Complex. At the Shotgun center club house you will find the same great BBQ. This is the second Road Kill, and I like it better. Same menu, same great food, and I think better service. While there check out the shotgun center, one of the best in this country...

kKj5U3no-LRqvWuvPiUJUQ.text: Great bbq! Its a small place with amazing food! I've been here several times. Tried the ribs, tri-tip, hot links, pulled pork, and rib tips. The mac and cheese is cheesy and delicious. Potato salad, yams and baked beans are great too. And the portions are huge.  They also have a fresh meat counter that sells fresh meats thats great too.

mPDEuDKfsxeDb1dwM30ISA.text: Having moved from Kansas City, I wasn't hopeful on finding quality local BBQ. However, this has entered my top 5 favorite BBQ spots of all time.   There will be a line, so plan to wait. The workers are great. The building is located in the middle of the neighborhood. So, if you blink you'll miss it. It definitely lives up to the branding of a "dive".   Ribs, brisket & sides were enough to put me out! Great spot that I look forward to going back to!

photos.caption: Photo of John Mull's Meats & Road Kill Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ribs, brisket, mac-n-cheese, baked beans &amp; corn bread?!? Yes please!!!

GzFtYyOPGdIGllZGjdrNxw.text: Best food ever! We had our wedding catered by John Mull's because the food is so delicious! We had brisket, pulled pork, baked beans, Mac n cheese, rolls, Mac salad, potato salad and spicy hot links. We got so many compliments!! Everyone went back for seconds and wanted to know where we got the food. Best kept secret in town! We served 125 people (many had 2 or 3 plates of food!) for just under $1,000 which is a steal! We have leftovers too! If you have an event coming up, do yourself a favor and get the food from John Mulls, they'll deliver your catering order for $25. We are customers for life! My husband has them process his meat after hunting and has always been happy with it. Oh, they sell eggs too!!!

GZyMxWLujSzA7BL_g3yBiw.text: So overated. I really wanted to like it but this place blows. You can't BBQ with plastic forks, the line is insane. I didn't get sick from it.

Wnh6wyWJRd9jWlRK8JO3UQ.text: Everyone knows the legend that is John Mull's and if you don't.... get here now! This is a True working mans barbecue joint. It's what BBQ is supposed to be. Not fancy, but slow and steady cooked delicious fare that warms the soul.  They accomplish this in every point. My only qualm is the indoor building is not at all setup to be a takeout place. The door and the line just don't gel, it makes for a very confusing and annoying visit sometimes. I'm sure there is nothing that can be done about it but it is what it is. I've recently been turned into the butcher side of things. Good lord the steaks here are high quality and extremely well priced for what you get. You pay half here what you would at a restaurant for the same steak. All you have to do is cook it! Thanks John Mull's.

fQMIqb1FHWzW5BDZ-BMPGA.text: This place of off the hook!!! The barbecue is the best I've had in Vegas love it I will always go back there when I can because the food is incredible. The service is always top-notch the people are friendly and you can tell they love their job. M

pmR93MfR2awS1cdC3C-yaA.text: Great food, friendly staff, service is orderly and organized.  Highly recommend.  They are also a butcher shop so don't forget that.  They have some specialty cuts that you may not find in regular grocery stores like turkey butts.  Didn't get the last star because the location is out of the way.

WlsZhIsdFzFG3Vr0uFqRUg.text: Location/ambience: 3 Staff: 5 Food: 4 Likeliness to return: 3 Likeliness to recommend 3  After a morning of hiking at Mt Charleston, we were ready for some protein!!!  The location: Ranch-like space within residential area.  We ordered in a small cramped room and seating was outdoors. Luckily it wasn't too hot outside.  However, the tables outside were clean and the bathroom was also very clean!  Staff: Friendly, helpful, and keeping busy. Excellent!  Food: We were pretty disappointed everything was in warmers.. it was 2:30pm, we weren't sure if it'd be different had we come in the morning?  Flavor of the rib tips, brisket, and pull pork was excellent!! However, being in the warmer made it dry and doesn't visually look fresh.  Collard greens also had great flavor. Chili was too watery, my Coca Cola was not cold (that made me really sad lol) but I normally don't like BBQ sauce and I really enjoyed their spicy tangy jam like consistency sauce!  Likeliness to return: We live in Spring Valley, the experience isn't enough to make a trip, but if we're in the area.. maybe? If nothing else around the area interests me. Cuz for $16.99 we got a decent amount of food  Likeliness to recommend: I would recommend, if someone's in that area, if they're less picky with experiences and just want some decent food to fill their stomach. But not if they're super hungry, though we got lucky, I saw other reviews mention the long lines.

G6nZJBhpcki6ozLOnhdbJQ.text: The ribs are Damn good but the peach cobbler, son-don't worry about eating it - I'll eat your share too ummm-mmm! Great place to take family for a literal night out. Get your supper and set at the picnic table let the kids run around - get there early it gets crowded quick. We usually take home a tray of ribs and cobbler.

pjQbRtKFPjpuhZSVF3L_mw.text: John Mull's is the best butcher in Las Vegas.  Prime choice meats that are masterfully butchered by professionals.  You can place your order in advance, but I like watching the artful skills and technics.  While you are there, have lunch at the Road Kill Grill.  Yummy smoked meats and sides to choose from. Kick back and relax.   They do not disappoint!  5 star Quality and service.   Mary Ann

UGYefs-1sNhxFsrcPIiKkQ.text: This place is horrible , customer service sucks, people are rude and good luck getting your order. They took my order and gave it to somebody else.  How to wait for my order all over again

lNaLthz6qWl1we7DuPWUzw.text: Best barbeque in Las Vegas that I've tried so far, lines are sometimes crazy, but what else would you expect for food this good!

yvmQu13IHPd0vn_iWSctTQ.text: Meat market is amazing! Roadkill grill is the best BBQ in Vegas!!!  If you want a great meal or plan on BBqing this place is the best!

__o_L27JQ00grsHrxMNtVw.text: Let me start by saying I am from the Deep South.  I moved here from the Mississippi Delta (just south of Memphis) four years ago.  With that being said, I happen to know two things in life- good food and good people.   Today was the second time I have picked up a catering order from Road Kill for my office.  I am currently still in a euphoric state.  Pulled pork, brisket, collard greens, Mac n cheese, Cole slaw & peach cobbler is what we picked up today.  The food is on point and everybody at work agrees.  Shout out to Rita for helping me place my order and ALL of the staff for their friendly disposition.  There is nothing sub-par about this place.  They have THE BEST barbecue this side of the Mississippi.  I HIGHLY recommend doing business with John Mulls/Road Kill Grill.

opEU7ks4VLdTK-1mh5Gzow.text: The try tip (Tuesday/Thursday) is out of this world. Very tender, very flavorful, and an experience onto itself.  Order ahead or expect a 45 minute wait. This place is popular.

photos.caption: Photo of John Mull's Meats & Road Kill Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Simple yet do you

1arIx_fyD5nYBdixOL5kAQ.text: There are some places that treat you well and there are some places that treat you right. This food joint treats you right.  I love this place! I caught Guy Fieri's Drive Ins, Diners and Dives and I took my family to test the offerings. My order was a rib combo with tri-tip, baked beans and mac & cheese. To get this combo, you have to be here Tuesdays or Thursdays. It's not served any other days. The baked beans they were to die for! Great taste and right amount of sweetness and BBQ you'd want in the baked beans with a bit of meat lurking in there. These ribs are the best in town: great chew, meaty, fall off the bone-type stuff and not slathered with too much sauce. Most of the flavor comes from the prep where they vacuum seal it into the meat in prep for hours. Genius! The mac and cheese is equally a crowd pleaser. I could have that for days. The price is right and we will be back to test the fabled brisket and peach cobbler. I can't wait!  Speaking of waiting, we waited a while. So get here before opening if you don't like lines. I say 10:30 am is about right these days. But if you're in a line, no worries! I don't know if this is normal but it seemed normal so I'll report it. I already walked away with my order when I saw this. The line was a good 200 feet long or more. people were going to have to wait because when you get to the pick up area people hem and haw a bit. I know some of these people are standing in line for about a good  1/2 hour already and it's about 12:30 pm. So one of the cooks comes out from the cooking and has one of those trays/containers you see that they put in the food warming cart to keep things hot and ready to eat. And he goes to everyone who hasn't seen the cashier yet and gives each one a rib to tide them over until they can get their order in. How cool is that?!?  What's my bottom line? Give them your money and eat their food. This is championship quality BBQ at great prices. My actual rating is a 4.7 stars...

photos.caption: Photo of John Mull's Meats & Road Kill Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rib and tri-tip combo with baked beans and mac and cheese. Mighty fine dining!...
Photo of John Mull's Meats & Road Kill Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spacious outdoor eating...
Photo of John Mull's Meats & Road Kill Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rib and tri-tip combos. You only get these on Tuesdays and Thursdays...

x-X-nLn4mH_AbEpCvEZ_yA.text: This is where i wish i could do half scores. This is a solid 3.5. Not quite a four but better than 3.   My wife and i split the 3 meat meal. This is pretty common for us at bbq places and we both left relatively satisfied. We got the tritip, brisket, and ribs. I think the ribs were a hair dry but i attribute that to being the end of the day (30 mins before close). The rest of the meat was great though i am a fan of thicker cuts of meat.   For the sides we got the mac and cheese and the baked beans. The mac and cheese was amazing!! Perfect richness and flavor. Typically i am not a fan of baked beans, but these were a hybrid between baked beans and  chili and i loved them. The one weird note would be the corn bread... It wasn't bad but was definitely too sweet. Tasted more like cake than corn bread. My other note would be the hot bbq sauce, it just wasnt hot at all. It was still good just not perfect.   Overall pretty great bbq. Not the best but far from the worst. I would go again if i were in town. Price was solid for the amount of food and the taste was pretty solid.

WyxDyvCsG3TNTG6bZw49ow.text: Great BBQ spot, food with lots of flavor. Ribs and brisket were like butter. My son loved the Mac and cheese. Nice outside Punic tables with mist to keep cool.

k37Tr7gwrBTz_8eV2Z2pIA.text: Great food looove the corn bread. Mac n cheese is amazing and it doesn't matter how long the line might seem they get u in and out omg did I say I love this place

JdWmzRvxJmHSzaBXJ0svSw.text: I LOOOOVVEEEE BBQ, LOVE IT! And John Mull's delivers the goods every time. I prefer ribs from another restaurant but I have some things here that I crave regularly. Their Mac N Cheese is ahmazing! I think I had it best when we ordered a whole tray at work and it was the best I've ever had. I usually order the chicken and double order of Mac N' Cheese and my sweetie gets the pulled chicken and hot links. The ribs are pretty good, just not my favorite and pulled pork and hot links are good as well. I also like their coleslaw and yams. Oh, be prepared to wait in line for a WHILE. There is usually a looooong line but the establishment takes care of it's costumers and you'll be offered cold beverages while waiting.

jdZ0XS6Zdi-mJ4ou3EI4uQ.text: Huge portion sizes, great prices, delicious food. I went with a large group, and we all left full, happy, and with leftovers. The chicken I got was moist and flavorful, and the service was quick and friendly. The wait time was a bit long (again, I was with a large party, and this place is so good that of course it's going to be busy), but it was well worth it. I can't wait to take my barbeque-loving friends to this hole in the wall.

1EDNcaOjWVB8fPgchNEZAg.text: This is possibly the most unsuspecting restaurant in Vegas.  It is smack in the middle of a residential neighborhood and looks more like a ranch versus a place where you can buy meat and great BBQ. When I got there the line was ridiculously long BUT they did have free beer to help the time go by (KUDOS!). John Mull's has the BEST BBQ in Las Vegas! I moved to Las Vegas from Tennessee a few years ago so I am well aware of what real deal BBQ should taste like.  This place definitely reminded me of Memphis BBQ and was, dare I say, even better than what you can get in downtown Memphis.  Everything down to the sauce was delicious. My only gripe would be to serve some type of Texas toast or cornbread versus a big roll of sandwich bread. I wasn't a huge fan of the cole slaw either but everyone else in my family loved it.  Try the pulled chicken and potato salad. They will change your life!

OvXS8sm7JMDeHsjA1NrU_g.text: I'm a big fan of barbecue and was referred to this place by a coworker for the next time I was in Vegas.  My wife and I stopped by and were not disappointed.  Fantastic smoked meats, sides loaded with flavor, and loaded portions.  My wife and I split a 3 meat plate (comes with two sides) and were stuffed before we could finish everything.  You can get different combinations (1 meat and some sides) for 8-12 bucks, two meat plates are 12-14 I believe, and our three meat plate was 16.  If you're getting individual entrees, expect to pay 20-30 dollars.  My wife and I got by on 16 and were stuffed.  They have drinks and waters for $1 as well.  Depending on when you go, there may be one or two lines.  We had a line outside and a line inside the Saturday we stopped by.  Both lines get you the same grub, so be sure to pick whatever's shorter.  They have brisket, pulled pork, ribs, chicken, and hot links.  If you like some heat, the hot links are to die for.  Get them cut up and covered in sauce.  They have amazing sides as well.  We got the mac and cheese and the baked beans.  Mac and cheese was phenomenal.  Baked beans were good, but impossible to top the mac and cheese.  I've heard the desserts are pretty good too, but we were too full to try them out.  If you're in Vegas, check this place out.  A little drive from the strip (about half an hour with traffic) but it is more than worth it.

oOF0wBVWz79MNRJ6uqtjKA.text: Best BBQ in Nevada. Brisket, rib tips, Pulled pork or chicken, and you MUST get some of the Mac and Cheese.

rVoKepoFSewYIs5EDxZowA.text: Wonderful stop!!! Owner kind enough to pose for a pic and staff incredibly nice!!! Food was incredible!!

photos.caption: Photo of John Mull's Meats & Road Kill Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Y_Bq1H6R0esSJKXF8t87Hw.text: Delicious BBQ. Reasonable prices for the quality and quantity. And FREE SMELLS! Their Mac & cheese is also delicious!

nOkK-kBW6BOHtUwKVEgl2Q.text: Being from the South, its been hard for me to live without that good southern-style bbq until I came across John Mull's. The brisket is always so moist, the ribs are just fall-off-the-bone tender. The sides are full of flavor, if I close my eyes, it's almost like I'm back down South. Definitely my favorite place for BBQ in Las Vegas.

66bKxbaPup-8amckRAKJFg.text: Oh! How I love this place!!! The hotlinks are pretty much a staple of mine! A definite must try! :-D

DJUe8WnTXB2MXcnACJq1Gg.text: Looooong wait for hot food! I thought a Tuesday afternoon would be slow, but no way. I'll admit the food is worth the wait, but still they should expand or at least have a larger waiting area. My parents and I went for takeout during lunch time. We all ordered the 2 meat combo with 2 sides. The rib tips were delicious, perfect salty, smokey tenderness. The beef brisket was very tender as well. The portions are huge! For sides I tried the green beans and the maccaroni and cheese. The green beans were seasoned with smoked pork and surprisingly not overcooked. The maccaroni and cheese tasted like something I would have eaten at a "pig pickin" back home. It was wonderful, cheesy, creamy goodness. For the 3 of us for lunch, the bill came to $48, however we had enough leftovers for a second meal. If you've got a hankerin for some quality smoked meat, check this place out!

kk-HyI3enrsuiifIEUuzJg.text: My husband and I moved to vegas almost two years ago and he wanted to stock up our freezer. We chose John mulls meats as our butcher because the prices were very fair. Not sure how much we paid but it was a good price for half a cow's worth of meat. These guys are great, the food (at road kill grill) is phenomenal and the day we came in to pick it up we had to wait awhile since there were so many customers there and they still found a way to make it up to us for the long wait. I love this place and I will come again. The wait was worth it. Be aware that there are many ppl here to pickup catering orders around the holidays and especially at lunchtime. I've been here three times and there is always a long line of ppl at the road kill grill.

E8HE4RHrgGxY388N6-zFaw.text: Excellent! Food is sooo good. Had the ribs, brisket, pulled pork with Mac & Cheese and greens. Delicious! Be prepared to wait in line if you come at lunch time but it is worth the wait.

ocioMQSgqPpITk1fau0JjQ.text: Love this place!  The rib tips were amazing! Good amount of meat and it comes in a full plate with a side. Husband loved the pulled chicken.  Spicy bbq is just right.  Not super spicy but just right. Now im craving this place like crazy.

ddBUIJf72g8wPcUNVbO1Eg.text: BEST BBQ I have had. I'm so spoiled now I won't be able to eat at a normal BBQ restaurant  again

J0fHfffxFJ7A3KRflILzhA.text: The portions are bountiful. I got the pulled chicken with mac & cheese and baked beans. The mac & cheese is rich and cheesy, no skimping on the whole-milk ingredients in their recipe. The baked beans are good and seemed to have ground beef or pork in them, not sure which, but I didn't expect that added item. Finally, the pulled chicken was good too, I just wished it had more barbecue sauce but luckily they let you take barbecue in little containers, so I was able to douse my chicken. Anyway, this is a great bang for your buck for the amount of food and overall quality.

8adZF5KwGyMXdmhh0I3_xg.text: #1BBQ IN TOWN I have lived in North Las Vegas for 18 yrs. and just drove by this place yesterday--smelled wonderful.  We went and ordered 2 3 meat combos with pulled pork, tri tip, ribs, sausage and chicken breast.  The sides collared greens, pork-n-beans, potato salad and Cole slaw.   The food is EXCELLENT.  I will be back.   #1 BBQ IN TOWN

riXO2l5cdhMVlbe93eHk0w.text: Awesome. Great sausage (the sliced ones in the BBQ sauce), brisket, ribs, and pulled pork. Friendly staff! The hot BBQ sauce is definitely the best and isn't too hot at all. Casual. Sit outside on picnic tables which on a day like today was prime - minus some bees flyin around :0

photos.caption: Photo of John Mull's Meats & Road Kill Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Main menu (several other options available, though)
Photo of John Mull's Meats & Road Kill Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brisket, ribs, and sausage. Potato salad and beans as the side. Roll. BBQ sauce comes on the side.

fCsqkudbCtzSlHdF8YeuTQ.text: So. My girl comes here every chance she can get when she is in Vegas. We came here for lunch today. Ordered the 3 meat combo and a hot link sandwich. Plain and simple this was some excellent Bbq. With or without the sauce I was impressed. The sides were good. Mac & cheese out of this world in my opinion. Customer service behind the counters great! Kudos to this Resturant. Will definitely be back.

GhaxhD3efQ8-InRi6fnqIw.text: Love it is all I can day.  Great food, great employees.  It's a pleasure to be a customer.

8vwYQKVBDkuu-opzbsXnpA.text: Stopped by this BBQ joint while in Vegas, loved the food! Portions were huge. The hot links & rib tips were excellent, loved the mac & cheese. If in the area I would definitely recommend :)

jufPZhDjRm2x_STitj-ovg.text: I would say this gets 4.75 stars and I round up!   The good: The food is OUT OF SIGHT! At least as good as I have ever had and a few items that are off the CHARTS good! The two items that come to mind is the mac and cheese and the brisket. Both are the best I have ever had. The portions are HUGE!!! I love that as big as I am (6'5, 260) I can easily make two meals out of their 3 meat combo. The service is great and they really make you feel at home. You feel apart of the family and I love that type of experience!  The bad: There is no indoor seating. The drive is LONG if you live in the south side of town.

qMvE_pPtgbFAfs_XQarXJA.text: Without a doubt the best BBQ so far and I've eaten a lot of BBQ of all stripes. Aside from the incredible brisket, mouth watering ribs, moist and flavor ridden chicken and the tasty links a special shout out to the cornbread and mac and cheese, must haves. Even the cashier Brenda made life livable with her bright eyes and quick wit.  As visitors from NY we were treated like royalty particularly by the Brooklynite  grill man.

6Yt77aG1lBsNTXHsP2rTzA.text: All I have to say is you have to try this place...oh and the Mac'n cheese was amazing!!! Stop searching and looking at all the Yelp reviews just go and find out for your self!!! If it was on DDD come on you know it's good!!!! The only thing I thought need some improvement was the customer service there was no customer service

5Cq76lSumZlqQxWGd8E7ww.text: John Mulls is very clean and organized. I've purchased meats and prepared food. The free eggs are also a plus. Pricing is very good and the quality of the meats are great. The bacon is soooo good. It is a jewel in the community. Two Thumbs Up!

g6dfOolrpio6ReZUKTF2-w.text: I bought a small smoked turkey for $45 dollars here for my New Year party table.  When I got home and opened the "aired sealed" package I was disgusted by the rotten smell that immediately struck me. I should have questioned why the turkey was brought from the back in a box and not shown to me. Once I opened the box I immediately noticed that the air sealed turkey was not sealed properly. I am very disappointed by the quality of the meat that was sold to me here.

kr_2nIDh4oyG5yNUCsKqag.text: We used them for catering a staff lunch a few months ago. I went to pick up the order and everyone was very friendly and it was an east process. We had brisket, pulled pork, beans, Mac and cheese and rolls. it was probably the BEST BBQ I have had in Vegas. I was surprised to find they also butcher there. I probably should have guessed but it was very interesting watching while my order was put together.

tPxO0TlZhXsjd4exRtG3_A.text: Omg!!! The best BBQ place in Las Vegas hands down! There was a pretty long line but well worth the wait. I had the pulled pork dinner with corn bread and macaroni and cheese and potato salad for sides. The corn bread is literally the best corn bread I've ever had! The pulled pork has the best flavor and they give you A LOT! the macaroni and cheese and the potato salad were so delicious. Every thing was fresh and taste homemade but better! I also had enough food in this one "dinner" to have two meals. My fave, I'm hooked!

1ZvN9I16wJv57jnlsNM6jQ.text: the food is amazing. great flavor & very fresh. they give more than generous portions. definitely has that good home cooking feel & taste to go right along with it!   I will be back :D

IzrDWNdx5RjSfpI32QjpNQ.text: Delish! A bit small inside..does not help when it's warm as well. But friendly staff and pretty quick service! Amazing Mac and cheese...I love it! Everything else is very good but the Mac and cheese is so tasty!

Rf1eOlufaG6li8aAa9lLYw.text: World class Ribs, Pulled Pork and Mac n Cheese. Must stop when in Vegas. As seen on Diners Drive Ins and Dives. 15 min from strip. BOOKMARK AND GO!!!!!

zlEM9K9lBrYCp9xQ0PRqIA.text: John Mulls Is absolutely amazing. If you're in the Vegas area, and are looking for amazing BBQ and an off-strip experience, this is the place to come. Best pulled pork and brisket I've had.

3JuXmZULfzSy1ULlRMIjDw.text: Johnny mulls is just the most delicious bbq ive ever had. I ordered the 3 meal combo should of ordered extra corn bread. But this place is a must go if you want the best bbq im town.

photos.caption: Photo of John Mull's Meats & Road Kill Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

qNopTVDTOJK2GxPbm2SNBQ.text: Best BBQ in town. Extremely friendly staff. Was taken on a tour and given the history of the restaurant. You can go in the back and watch the smokers and grilling in live time.   Brings the whole family. Portions were very generous and the prices weren't bad at all. Had the ribs & brisket which were excellent. Cornbread literally tasted like butter.  A++

RwxhZ2RZ410UnLlLeXoavw.text: The BBQ is the best I've had since I left Chicago and came to Southern California in November 2013,and could quite possibly be the best I've had period,and I'm not just saying that because it was "FREE"on the day I was there on 4/25/2016.Got there 15 minutes before closing and it's an outdoor eatery only and it had been raining all day so I guess they decided to give the food away,the staff was awesome whatever you wanted on your plate or plates they happily gave it to you and each and everyone of them apologized for the weather,imagine that!! This is my new go to spot when I'm in Vegas from now on,hands down the best!!!

YRA9DBvRfH209KGSU9B3ug.text: This place was awesome and gives plenty of food. I went there for lunch and now eating more for dinner now.

photos.caption: Photo of John Mull's Meats & Road Kill Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. So good! Chicken and brisket!

LEGsNfrxlpP7pKoRo4byZw.text: This is the 4th time we've been here. Since we're from San Diego, we only get to come a few times a year. This is absolutely the best barbecue we have ever had. The only hard thing is having to eat outside during the summer weather in vegas, but it is so worth it. Love the food the service is very friendly. Recommend it.

c3Pf_hKi-BOhXXMIwQ6CYg.text: Best bbq we have ever had.  Always make it a point to stop when we're in Las Vegas

RIuGt2i3Jf0VXUI9Fw-Izg.text: This place is no joke. Fresh smoked brisket, pulled pork, tri tip (on Thursdays), chicken and hot links. Everything made in house. In house smoked bacon, and they process your kills. These guys are experts at their craft. Multiple smokers on site and their own kill room. Homemade spices and BBQ sauces. They even do cheeses. This place is tucked away and looks rather small, don't let that detour you. It is worth the trip!! You can also get raw meats on site or delivered to you..

jhWeNRQK8cmxDYJXpUYUmw.text: I went to the restaurant today the flavor was good, but the meat was not tender. The Mac&Cheese and the yams were great, they need to work on the customer service skills with the server. Poor customer service can cause the company to have problems.

ipzQj325554XLAIEubI94A.text: This is definitely a unique set up the food is AMAZING very quick the corn bread is the best I've ever had. Pricing is reasonable I always split my order with my friend although some of my other friends do finish their meal on their own

UvROBfMGManfTD1rdBnIYw.text: Outstanding BBQ and friendly staff at this place! Guy Fieri was right on! It's always a huge plus when the staff have fun and seem to love what theyre doing!!! The food is AMAZING!!!

BtL6FJZym_YjvqJX1_2wFQ.text: Food is great for catering and take home meals.  No real restaurant environment. Patio or picnic dining.   Meats to purchase and take home to cook.  Mac and cheese is something way better than Kraft lol.  Great food

YQ_zTXgn1es6BJrmS8b0JQ.text: Their elk salami is one of a kind.  The owners and staff are always friendly and make a point of going above and beyond to help

NlhFQs-M06_6xIprM1bamw.text: This place is definitely over hyped. Hate I wasted my so much money on cafeteria food. I didn't even eat it after the first 2 bites and through the other sandwich completely away. Definitely could've took that $40 somewhere else for a better meal.

mQ2wOcryXmbX5S2hq64iDQ.text: Well, we finally made it to John Mull's. One of my coworkers swears this is the best bbq in the area. He was right. The bbq was scrumptious. The only reason I didn't give them 5 stars is I don't really care for stems in my greens. Fortunately, there was not a lot of them in my portion. Note: the greens does have a little spicy  hint, but it is not overwhelming. We recommend John Mull's, you won't be disappointed.

u1qvFND8RAN_nQsRrwMSvg.text: I'm from Texas and I was raised in Mississippi most of my life. I was raised on a charcoal grill and with Southern Baptist church potluck soul food. I have been very reluctant and hesitant about trying barbecue out here in Las Vegas because it's so near and dear to me, and it breaks my heart when people do it wrong. Suffice it to say, all of my concerns have been put to rest and I am a fan for life!   I ordered brisket, hot links, and pulled pork (they were out of burnt ends which did disappoint me, but I was in the back of a very long line later in the afternoon) with a side of mac and cheese, collard greens, and some peach cobbler for dessert. Brisket had great flavor, hot links were perfectly spicy (I'd call em about a 6 or 7 for white people lol), pulled pork had great texture, collard greens were a smidge bland (maybe I'd add some hot sauce), and the mac and cheese had a great sauce and melted cheese on top; they were delicious!   The peach cobbler was amazing too; the only thing that was missing was a scoop of vanilla bean ice cream. I immediately felt like I was back in the South, especially with the warm and friendly staff. I could hardly have enjoyed the food or my visit anymore; I will be returning and bringing as many people as I can with me!

I had the burnt ends rib tips collard greens green beans and brisket oh sooooo yummy in my tummy!! You must go here. This is in North Las Vegas. You won't be disappointed!!

3kjJ2uOWH3qJqmE60XDK_w.text: Excellent ribs!  I ordered the five rib plate and was pleasantly surprised that they were tender and juicy, besides being flavored with a not-to-salty bbq rub. The staff was friendly and fast. Their baked beans had a slightly sweet flavor, but it wasn't overdone. I wanted green beans but they gave me baked beans, it was my fault for using a cell phone with a bad connection though. Their collard greens could have had a tiny bit more bacon, but I always say that. Overall great experience!

J65ItpKLzowWWd_HP1y84g.text: I can't say enough about this place. The food is amazing, the best bbq I've ever had. The burnt end specially. The corn bread is to die for and the Mac & Cheese is out of this world. There's sometimes a line but definitely worth it.

7YIrPD4-tLO0MxAeZGQV9w.text: Such a cool place. No dine in but you carry out to picnic tables. Pretty busy. Burnt ends and ribs were excellent. I prefer the hot bbq sauce to the mild. All the veggies were excellent.

zKtbsVC0lSsz78ssuZ9Zrw.text: We love this place so much!!! We always come back and the service is amazing. I highly recommend it to all my friends because it's hard to find a spot in vegas where you can actually Enjoy the meal!!!

D3yChy1Yfxq3LvzN341mmg.text: Always pleased when I visit John Mulls, very happy customer. This place has been close to m Grandmas for years and I never knew. Now that I know the have a customer for life. Always great customer service as well.

yKIDi7A0reLC8jDot-dRJA.text: This place was really good if you like local good cookin BBQ! I have never heard of this place until a friend of mine talked about it and we went. I am sure glad we did! It literally looks like your driving thru a subdivision and then there is it. They have very friendly staff working there and helpful on customers who have never been there, they recommend they think you might like. They also have a meat shop and a place where people go to bring their meat to be prepared for them. I was disappointed when I got my meal it was very generous quantities and really good, they give you more than I think you will eat, probably so you can take the goodness home with you. I will definitely be back here again and will bring others as well. Their brisket, potatoe salad, and Mac n cheese was very good that is the mean I got also the cornbread it sweet also. I would recommend this place for sure to anyone wanting to try a non chain BBQ place!

dHMWBiikJj6Y8b1iGn_58A.text: This place is awesome. Line was long and worth the wait. Owner was out handing out ribs as samples. Kind of out of the way but worth the drive. Meat was tender and full of flavor. More food then I could eat!!

fevLDiwh4Dx9KE7Q59-KnA.text: If you go around the Holliday's it is very busy. But it's worth the wait. And you can always order lunch while you're waiting at their outside restaurant. Really good bbq.

irQr1Px6eEDET5-4A6YwSA.text: This place is yummy and the second restaurant is at the very top of North Decatur and is not as busy as the original one. The pulled pork is great and all the food is good.

XuaWnbrT46bKgVGtXq_ojA.text: I never had macaroni and cheese that I dreamed about until I had their Mac and cheese !! I can't stop thinking about it ! The burnt ends and the brisket was tender and delicious! The greens were flavorful and not bitter ! I've gotten take out twice and can't wait to get my BBQ fix , luckily I live about a half mile away  Keep up the great work!!

n-Qf3era-mpCCND6mYD63Q.text: Yummmmm. Pass it all the time but never stopped by until I had to pick up something for a party. The food was delicious and the people that work there are so nice.  Can't wait to get some steaks from there next... delish

87EMMMp7ubTbF4KxaGGovA.text: This place is incredible! The burnt ends are my absolute fav! I drive way out of my way to eat here because it is that good! It Reminds me of good southern cooking back home! There is usually a line so if you aren't eating there I suggest you call ahead for your order.

hSKMF4iG-VJhPPBW2LLV8A.text: Amazing selection of delicious meats, cheeses and pre-made foods!  Friendly staff who are always helpful.  I bought my parents a gift certificate for Christmas there last year and they have already asked for another one for this year!! I'm definitely going back!!

IyD8v_PAJCInTQf2FoC1Hw.text: I was super excited to try this spot, I saw so many awesome reviews, yet wasn't overly impressed. My bf ordered the two meat combo with ribs and hot links, his sides were Mac and cheese,and yams. I honestly think this meal  was just ok, the Mac and cheese was great texture wise, but lacked so much flavor! Bland to say the least, the hot links were good no issues with that , yams were basic nothing to go back for more. As far the ribs, they were very little, and we did wish they were cooked more, we  love a nice charred taste on the outside. Next we had the pulled pork sandwich, pork was great but def needed cole slaw, which it doesn't come with, but they were all out to order a side of it. The portion size was huge which was a plus, for my sides I got the Mac and green beans, as i said Mac was bland and the string beans were WAY TOO SALTY! Coming from someone loves flavor!  The beans should of lended some salt to the Mac! LOL!   **I will add that the prices are very reasonable, and I would probably give it another try, just not worth that long line they have every weekend!**

i0Aq8n-gtvT66_ep2DsLqw.text: Well, I have waited for a long time to get to this place. I have been to Vegas more than a few times, and never made it out to visit John Mull and take in the nostalgia of the Road Kill Cafe. John Mull's Road Kill Grill in Las Vegas, NV, yes the one visited by guy fieri from the food network, and voted the state's BBQ joint, was the destination for the day. We had every intention of going on Monday for lunch, alas being Las Vegas, we didn't make it there until Wednesday when were ready to head home. We arrived just at 10am, from the yelp page it showed open at that time so we were eager to return home and went early. We were first in line because the HOT food side didn't open till 11am. But we were first in line. John Mull was there tending to business as he was most every day, and greeted our party with a welcome handshake and warm greeting. Just that one minute he spent to shake hands and say hello, and ask us where we were from and thanked us for visiting, made us feel welcome. As this was the first time here for us, it was highly anticipated by the all in the group. It was something we had talked about at work for the previous month, each day closer heightened our desire to make this a definite stopping point on this trip to Las Vegas. For those who live there it is a gem to have such a well-established and high quality BBQ joint in their hometown. We arrived early enough to walk around and look at the memorabilia and take all the pictures we wanted. We figured to get inside and start the line at about 1045am and by the time we walked out the door with our food just after 11am there was more than 40 people in line. I was excited to finally make it to this BBQ joint. My friends and I all got something a little different as to try a larger cross section of the menu. I think we all got 3 meat plates which came with a roll and 2 side for $16.75ish, drink extra, sides of any of the menu items were available al carte. Burnt ends were the only thing that was not an option in the combo. Hot Links are really good, nice spice mixture, just a little heat not too much and not overpowering. I also chose pulled pork, and brisket. I must have had at least 2 plus pounds of meat; easily a dozen thin slices of brisket and enough pulled pork to fill a foot long hoagie roll; my choice of sides was coleslaw and potato salad. I was going to make my own pulled pork sandwich with the roll that came with the plate. Another of us got collard greens, one got beans, and mac n cheese was a big favorite. The collards, if you are fan of them, were super tender in texture, salty pork flavor from the hock, smokey and all kinds of good. Making the sandwich was a perfect idea and it was a great combination. BBQ pork and coleslaw sandwich was near perfection. Here it is 4 days later having eaten off this combo plate for 4 days and just finished the plate today. Sauces are good and made right there. Seating is on site under tents and bench style seating provides group atmosphere allows for chatty neighbors to delight with each other on the choices made for lunch; we thought about going for dinner but seeing how fast things lined up at lunch I would be surprised if there is anything left at the end of the day. I didn't take any pics, as the previous ones show all. All you need to know is this is HIGH LEVEL competition BBQ. Well worth a visit and the cost is great for the amount you get. 5 star quality, without question. I have read the reviews of others who have visited this place...let me say this; yes it is in the middle of a housing development. The houses were built around the business and has been at the same location for a long, long, long time, so fault Triple D for that? Whateves. The person that prepared our meal didn't ask if we wanted lean or fatty brisket, I got what they gave us. The seating is bench style covered patio style seating and there will be a line, how long the wait is can vary by the day. I would have like to have seen more types of sauces to go with the BBQ, but it still was good. I cant speak to someone else's experience, but my was 5 star all day.

3XNEfQ-005FLGxfqr5dXSA.text: It was my first time there yesterday. The line was short and we beat the rush. I ordered the beef rib. The sign says it takes about 20 min to get a rib. I paid for my colleague's meal with mine. The gentleman told me to wait outside to the left after I exit the door and they will call out my rib when it's ready. I waited for 20 min and nothing. I asked an employee and they said it'll be a few minutes. After 30 minutes I had to say something again. The gentleman working the register apologized and addressed the situation. I think communication needs to be more clear on orders.  The food:  Spicy link. It was cooked just right. Smothered in sauce and the snap was great when you bite into it. The tri-tip was amazing! Just the right amount of fat and meat in each bite. I would recommend this. Beef Rib. This was a tough one. I was looking forward to it. I love beef ribs and I have a few favorite spots in the Las Vegas/Boulder City Area. I would put this as a firm 3rd place in Las Vegas for Beef Ribs. The smoke ring was so thick it made the meat dry. The bark was very peppery and not well-balanced with the other seasonings. I think it was just too overdone to enjoy a good piece of meat. Maybe lessen the smoke time and concentrate on the moisture?  Sides:  MAC was ok. Not too dry, not too wet, the perfect paste-like texture in your mouth and full of cheesy flavor.  The beans were Bush's baked beans with their own twist on it. It was full of flavor, sweet and savory.  Greenbeans were good. Very simple.  The cornbread was gritty and semi-sweet. I enjoyed it.  Sauce: It's like a Kansas style sauce. In my opinion, I don't think it compliments the food well enough. I would suggest to try out other sauces to compliment the meats.

5Jnm57eji3gW-Qs0gqxbBA.text: So amendment to my previous review, contacted owner and they've addressed the issue, offered me a free meal for the family to give them a chance to make up for the previous service. So I'm changing my review to three stars pending my next visit. Was very cordial, and quick to respond to my messages and is making every effort to keep us as customers that goes a long way.   Service sucked so bad I waited 4th in line for 40minutes I couldn't tell you how the bbq tastes because I wasn't going to stand around waiting another 40minutes waiting for them to take an order

s731oHPbYqcFD-IvFOeV4w.text: Stopped by John Mull's to pick up some dinner and the place was packed. On the weekends they do all of the bbqing outside. The line wrapped around the building. My husband ordered the 3 item plate with hot link, brisket and ribs with collard greens. I got the burnt ends with Mac n cuz and green beans. Everything was good. Angel was working the register and was so helpful and kind. He was super busy and didn't let the people or the 110 heat get to him. He just kept a smile on his face.

_L1dcekOibh7LhPI9Ev9Cw.text: I typed 'bbq near me' into the Google maps search engine selected then read some reviews on Mull's bbq and decided to check it out. I was salivating and smiling as I pulled into the gravel lot just from the environment by itself, outdoor 100% with a nice cooling system underneath the tents. This place is nestled in the NW amongst a housing community (forreal) a real landmark it is. The brisket the links the potatoe salad the cobbler omg the food is amazing the portions are hearty, straight up bbq! The service is awesome and the prices are right even in the meat market with the fresh cut meat.

CtUfwDLwuuGSKOHWO6i7pQ.text: Came here for lunch on a weekday, right around 12pm. There was a short line to order, but definitely not busy compared to their peak days/hours. No frills... this place appears out of nowhere on a not so busy street, you park in a gravel parking lot, you lineup cafeteria style in a small space, and eat outdoors in the Las Vegas heat with huge fans blowing. With that said, the food and the overall experience was awesome!   You can tell the guys taking your order and working behind the counter work quick and want to keep the line moving.. but they're also very friendly and joke around with the customers.   Their combos come in huge servings, and there's almost no way around it. LoL. Their meat is all very tender and flavorful. The cornbread is moist, and all the sides compliment the meat so well. Very traditional.

mwKVv36kjfs5VIuMocrj6w.text: Had the tri tip, Chicken and sliced hot links.  The tri-tip was extremely tender and flavorful a must order, the chicken I personally will skip, good Flavor but a bit too dry for my taste the hot links slice are smothered in hot sauce and are very tasty. Had the burnt tips as a sample and they are amazing.  The beans were good, wished they but some of the burnt tips in those instead of the ground beef but they are good. Had the cole slaw and it's good but missing something, can't quite put my finger on it it was good just not great. The Mac & cheese is the bomb.  Had the cherry cobbler Enjoyed that.  Was too full to eat the corn bread. So maybe next time.   Food is all around excellent, will go back for sure. Go early they get very busy.  Got there at 4:30 on a Thursday 108 and the line was out the door. It does move pretty quick and they give samples so worth the wait.

aT2giGwJwzGKfKrhwYIfnA.text: This is the only place I go for BBQ! The food is always hot and fresh. I have tried rib tips, mac and cheese, yams, potatoe salad and BBQ chicken. Everything is always good!

aR0tUvbFrjdkfVMWNfmeXw.text: John Mulls has been around for a really long time. Their style a barbecue is awesome.. Be preparedTo stand in line it's worth it. Not a fancy restaurant just great food. And a meat market.

UioEsEa3_4ahFknfPY9j9Q.text: Food fantastic, process for serving?...whoa, someone needs to help them out. Everything relies on one person to serve up food and how everything is laid out isn't helping them. But let's focus on the food. Yum! I had the ribs... My litmus test for any BBQ joint. But a shared a sample of the burnt ends with the guy behind me (thank you!) Wow! Those are with coming back to.

IwNz_yokc3YaIuNigtXD9g.text: No, thank you. Firstly, a big BOOO to Diners, Drive Ins, and Dives for even promoting this joint in the first place.  The restaurant is in the middle of some subdivision/neighborhood, and definitely out of the way. But you know, for some good grub, we said - WHY NOT? Well, the answer should've been NOT.  BBQ Brisket and Pulled Pork = NASTY. Brisket were dry and tasteless. Pulled pork tasted like boiled pork then boiled further in bbq sauce. The sauce itself was not even that good - I mean, may as well had bought the low-end brand BBQ sauce from the grocery store. Sheez.  Side items that I tried were beans, mac and cheese, and macaroni pasta. All were delicious, but not enough to get past one star. I mean, we came for the BBQ.  Seating outside only - which is a much preferred area since the smell inside coming from the kitchen straight up smell like refrigerated animal blood and bleach. I had to step out and let my dude stay in to make may order, to which it took us over an hour to get our food that was so not worth it. We shouldve known to walk dafuq away when that stench hit my nose, but you know, we were willing to push forth with the promise of some banging bbq.  Now, keep in mind youre in the middle of the desert so the outside is hot and dry, and there are no fans whatsoever - so be prepared if you still decide to go.  Anyways, when my dude came back with the food, he kept laughing at the fact that the cashier in the front was high AF, and she was the main reason why the line moved so slow and why it took forever to get the food. She kept forgetting things, asking for the same things over and over, and moved like molasses. Now, they did gave us free cold water bottles while waiting in line, so kudos to that.  All in all, we ended up eating all of the side items and a quarter of the BBQ  that we ordered. The rest went straight to trash right along with our expectations.  Ye have been warned.

khzlFli6V0cJT3ut1KpV0g.text: This place is the shit. Get the burnt ends. Get the Mac and cheese. Everything else is also great, but these two items are the best I think. I used to always get the hot links and the ribs, but then one of the dudes came around with a tray of ends to sample on line and I got hooked man. This place is legit, if you like bbq you'll love it. I hear they also do a great butcher shop and game dressing.

4uUpPaUqiwtfw1wJofefjw.text: I have been hearing good reviews about this place and wanted to check it out.   Always on the hunt for a good BBQ place.   My order was to go, it was busy but I did not have to wait too long and food portions were good.  My order had  the potato salad, beans, chicken and brisket, corn bread muffin, and peach cobbler.   The BBQ sauce was excellent, good blend of spices, tartness, and sweetness. Rating my meal I would say the star of the show was the brisket.  It was very flavorful and soft just like brisket should be.  Everything else in my meal was good.  This will be a place I can come back to to enjoy some good BBQ.

fljjIoILQa8TQCFkBwjV8w.text: I've had them bookmarked for a year or 2. I even drove past once, but the line deterred me from stopping. Well I went to another bbq joint before coming here which was closed for no apparent reason so today was the day for them to get a shot! I came in about 130pm and there were 2 people in line and being new I didn't know where to start so I asked a guy where to order he said here, I got the 5 bone rib dinner w/yams & greens. Then I kind of just stood there w/no further instructions from the guy until a lady asked would I like bbq sauce if so mild or hot, I got hot on the side. She then waived me down to her to pay and she bagged my food. It was a quick in & out experience.   FOOD WAS FRESH & DELICIOUS. THE GREENS WERE DELICIOUS!!!! YAMS DELICIOUS!!! RIBS WERE GOOD TOO!! NOT BOILED BULLSH*T!!! I'LL BE BACK.

eQuvHtaXW5wWqdaNhC3AXw.text: It's only taken us 2.5yrs to finally check out this place. We originally found this place watching Guy Fieri's Diners, Drive in's & Dives.   First of all I want to say how awesome their customer service is. From the person taking our orders, to the cashier, to the guys BBQing & the owner, John!!! I wanted to take a picture of the BBQ area & was greeting with the warmest smile & kindness by John & was offered a tour of the whole place. We saw everything from the butchers area, freezer to the prepping area.   We got the brisket dinner with collard greens & yams & the 3 meats (brisket, hot link (the best thing we ate) & pork) dinner with Mac & cheese & macaroni salad.   John brought over "burnt ends" for us to try. I will not get anything but that next time!!!!!! It's the part of the brisket that is seasoned, so it's so flavorful. The portions were large. I didn't even eat half of my meal. I regret not trying their ribs. We will definitely get that next time too. I will try other sides since I wasn't a fan of the ones we got. Next time I will try the coleslaw & baked beans.
